metadata.title: CVE-2021-28429 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer overflow vulnerability in av_timecode_make_string inlibavutil/timecode.c in FFmpeg version 4.3.2, allows local attackers tocause a denial of service (DoS) via crafted .mov file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-28429` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra59 - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
libavcodec59 - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
libavdevice59 - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra8 - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
libavfilter8 - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
libavformat-extra - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
libavformat-extra59 - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
libavformat59 - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
libavutil57 - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
libpostproc56 - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
libswresample4 - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
libswscale6 - 7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:5.1.2-3ubuntu1').
